page.title: 17SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: Exactly 85 years after the opening of Marylebone Station,British Rail in 1984 announced its closure but rejected the idea of converting the High Wycombe and Aylesbury lines into clearways. Commuters using Little Chalfont and Latimer Station (on the Aylesbury line) would have to travel to Paddington instead. B.R. claimed it would save a substantial amount of money and generate finance by redeveloping Marylebone. Commuters argued that their fares would increase by up to 20% since they would need to travel from Paddington to their place of work instead of walking from Marylebone. A pressure group was formed to keep the station open. Residents became interested as one of the area's attractions is easy access to Central London. In spite of appeals B.R.rejected alternative plans.
